titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Bernard Augustine De Voto Papers, 1918-1955 (inclusive), 1944-1951 (bulk) M0001

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2009-08-04T08:28-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.abstract: Correspondence, typescripts and galley proofs of 19 major works, 166 articles, 25 short fiction and non-fiction papers, broadcasts, speeches, lectures, and other papers. The correspondence (1948-55) with Harper's magazine relates to DeVoto's column The Easy Chair, and includes letters from Harper's magazine to senders of letters of condolence, and letters concerning DeVoto. Includes research material used in DeVoto's literary writings and in his work relating to politics, conservation and reclamation, free speech, national parks, and Western Americana. Correspondents include many of the leading persons in contemporary literature, politics, education, and the arts.

chronitem.event: Began schooling at Sacred Heart Academy, Ogden.
Graduated Ogden H.S.; entered University of Utah.
Entered Harvard College as a sophomore.

eventgrp.event: Writer's Handbook, A Manual of English Composition.

chronitem.event: Began part-time teaching at Harvard; instructor and tutor, 1929-1934; lecturer, 1934-36.

eventgrp.event: Birth of a son, Gordon King.

chronitem.event: The Saturday Review of Literature; </emph>moved to New York City. <emph render="italic">Forays and Rebuttals.
Awarded honorary Litt. D. by Middlebury College.

eventgrp.event: Awarded honorary Litt. D. by Kenyon College.
Trip West in summer led to conservation work.
Editor in chief of the History Book Club.
Won National Book Award for best non-fiction of 1952.

odd.head: Other Biographical Sources
odd.p: For additional material see the following:
Material in Box labeled "Biographical", including various genealogies, journals, a play concerning his life from 1920 to 1922, and the "Kent Potter" story.
Dissertation by Robert Edson Lee. (Includes a checklist of DeVoto's works).
Letters to DeVoto from Avis DeVoto and Marian M. Condliss.
Letters from DeVoto to Melville Smith, 1920-25;
Letters from DeVoto to Robert Forsythe, 1927;
Letters from DeVoto to Adrienne Burke, 3/27/44;
Letters from DeVoto to Natl. Inst. of Arts and Letters, 12/22/47;
Letters from DeVoto to Kate Sterne (safe) dated 10/6/27.
Pseudonyms: Cady Hewes; C.H.; John August; J.A.; Frank Gilbert; Richard Dye; Fairley Blake.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The DeVoto Papers contain Bernard DeVoto's correspondence date from 1918 until his death in November 1955. The bulk of the correspondence was written between 1944 and 1951. The collection also includes manuscript, typescript and galley proof copies of nineteen major works, 166 articles, 25 short fiction and non-fiction items, and about 44 broadcasts, speeches and lectures.

Of primary interest is DeVoto's research material used in his literary output and in his life-long work in many fields, including politics, conservation and reclamation, free speech, the national park systems and Western Americana.

Correspondents include many of the leading figures in contemporary literature, politics, education and the arts. A partial list of the correspondents is included in the Optional Section of this register.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Purchased from the estate of Bernard DeVoto, 1956; supplemented by gifts from various sources.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Bernard Augustine De Voto Papers, M0001, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Please page materials at least 36 hours in advance of intended use.
The family notes located in 1/22/466 are not to be photocopied although they may be read.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes scrapbooks and clippings chronologically arranged by decades. Some of these are in folders; the folders include references to Bernard DeVoto, subjects such as conservation, politics, etc., reviews of his books; and articles and stories.

physdesc.extent: Mrs. DeVoto's outlines and themes for Eng. class at Northwestern taught by BDV, some typescript, some ms. Ms. notes and corrections by BDV in pencil, corrections by ADV in red; there are long criticisms and questions by BDV on many of them, most with replies by ADV; some ms. themes of other members of the class-- some corrected with comments, a few by foreign students.
On Utah, Utah history, Mormons, Mormonism, and one on the 49'rs.
